H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7919.def: = state in which humans are able to accomplish whatever they attempt to do

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H6663.def: = state or process by which humans and deities are found to conform to an accepted code of behavior

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1215.def: = possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H5771.def: = a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7093.def: = state of having reached the terminal point of an event

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H6584.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = process by which a locust sheds its skin

H6174.def: = state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H8248.def: = state in which objects contain a certain amount of moisture

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7457.def: = condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H490.def: = woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3490.def: = person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H6341.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H6343.def: = process by which humans tremble or shake, ◄ as a result of a strong emotion of fear and concern for one's safety

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H1363.def: = state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H3556.def: = celestial body, providing light, and assisting the sun and moon in ruling day and night; ◄ created and controled by the divine; ≈ associated with a high and elevated position and sometimes personified as creatures that can sing and wage war

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1157.def: = path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space

H5645.def: = mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H2329.def: = dome-shaped structure; used exclusively to denote the firmament, which separates the waters above the earth from the earth itself; ≈ God is said to have his dwelling-place above this structure; it is also regarded as the boundary between light and darkness

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H4962.def: = human beings, regardless of sex and age

H1869.def: = action by which humans or animals move forward by lifting and setting down each foot in turn

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7059.def: = causative action by which deities take hold of humans ► in order to harm them

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H3247.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

H3332.def: = process by which liquids flow from one place to another

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7009.def: = person who intends to harm someone else

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H3824.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H1129.def: = causative action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H211.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Joktan<SDBH:יָקְטָן>}; descendant of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as the founder of a people living in a region with the same name

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6279.def: = action by which humans ask a deity earnestly to do something

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H1504.def: = causative action by which humans or deities divide objects into two halves

H562.def: = words spoken by humans and deities

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H5050.def: = process by which an object gives out or reflects a bright light

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1466.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H336.def: = area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH

H5355.def: = state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments

H1252.def: = state in which something is free of dirt or things that are regarded as pollutants; ≈ often used figuratively to describe being free of guilt

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.
